Article Title: Over 350 planes hit: Airbus A320 software snag set to cause major flight disruptions ‚Äî 10 things to know
Article Text:
Airbus A320 (Picture from Airbus official website)

Also Read |

10 things to know about the Airbus A320 recall



Airbus has ordered immediate repairs for around 6,000 A320-family aircraft, a move that is expected to affect more than half of the global fleet. This large-scale recall may cause widespread disruption, especially in the United States, where it coincides with one of the busiest travel weekends of the year.

Airbus has revealed that a recent incident involving one of its A320-family aircraft has uncovered a potential risk linked to "intense solar radiation", which may corrupt data essential for the aircraft's flight-control systems. Following this finding, the company identified a significant number of A320 aircraft currently in service that could be affected by the issue.

Air India has acknowledged the directive, saying it is ‚Äúaware of a directive from Airbus related to its A320 family aircraft currently in service across airline operators,‚Äù and noted that the requirement will involve a ‚Äúsoftware/hardware realignment‚Äù on part of its fleet. The airline has warned that "longer turnaround times and delays" are likely during the update process.

Air India recently completed a major retrofit programme for its older A320neo fleet. With 27 refurbished aircraft, 14 newly delivered A320neos, and additional planes added after the Vistara merger, the airline now operates around 104 A320-family aircraft with new or upgraded interiors.

IndiGo has also confirmed compliance with the directive, emphasising that ‚Äúsafety comes first‚Äù and stating that it is carrying out the updates ‚Äúwith full diligence and care.‚Äù The airline has indicated that some flights may see schedule changes while the work is underway.

Most of IndiGo‚Äôs A320 fleet consists of newer variants, with older models now in single digits. With over 350 A320-family planes, the airline is expected to complete updates on nearly 250 aircraft by Monday or Tuesday, according to sources. Air India, with about 120‚Äì125 A320s, is expected to finish updates on more than 100 aircraft in a similar timeframe.

Industry observers say this may be one of the largest recalls Airbus has faced in its 55-year history, as Reuters reported. The timing is notable, coming just weeks after the A320 overtook the Boeing 737 as the most-delivered aircraft model in the world.

The repair itself is expected to be relatively simple and mainly involves reverting to a previous software version. Even so, airlines must complete the process before the planes can return to passenger service, except for repositioning flights to repair centres.

Airlines across North America, South America, Europe, India, and New Zealand have warned that the required repairs could lead to delays or cancellations. American Airlines, the largest A320 operator globally, expects to update around 340 of its 480 A320s, with each fix likely taking about two hours.

Other major airlines‚Äîsuch as Lufthansa, IndiGo, and easyJet‚Äîare also planning brief groundings for the updates. In South America, Avianca has said more than 70% of its fleet is affected, leading the carrier to temporarily shut ticket sales until December 8 for certain travel dates.

The recall comes at a challenging time for the aviation industry, which is already dealing with heavy workloads at repair shops, long delays for separate engine-related inspections, and labour shortages. These factors are expected to slow down the completion of repairs and add further pressure to global flight operations.

JetBlue incident leads to probe



NEW DELHI: Air travel in India and around the world is expected to face major disruptions after Europe-based Airbus issued a technical directive ordering a software upgrade for its A320 family aircraft. In India, more than 350 IndiGo and Air India A320 planes will remain grounded for the next two to three days while the update is carried out, with normal operations expected to resume by Monday or Tuesday.Globally, around 6,000 aircraft from A320 fleet are likely to be impacted. The grounding is significant because Airbus and its main rival Boeing together control over three-quarters of the world's commercial aircraft fleet, meaning any large-scale recall has an immediate and widespread impact on global air traffic.The technical directive reportedly came shortly after an incident involving a JetBlue A320 aircraft, which led to discussions among safety regulators and eventually contributed to a deeper review of the fleet‚Äôs software configuration. While details are still emerging, the episode is believed to have triggered closer scrutiny and may have played a role in Airbus deciding to issue a global advisory and recall order for immediate corrective action.
Article Summary: Airbus has ordered immediate repairs for around 6,000 a320-family aircraft. The move is expected to affect more than half of the global fleet. Air india has warned that "longer turnaround times and delays" are likely. In india, more than 350 a320 planes will remain grounded for the next two to three days.

Article Title: Threat from AI-generated deepfakes: If all can be faked, how do you know what‚Äôs real?
Article Text:
.

Deepfake Shock: Nirmala Sitharaman Reveals Fake Videos Of Herself Online, Warns Of AI‚Äôs Dark Side

Armour up with TOI to fight deepening threat of deepfakes





In a world where seeing is no longer believing, India is facing a new digital menace: AI-generated deepfakes.These hyper-realistic videos and audio clips don‚Äôt just distort reality. They manipulate public perception, spread misinformation and undermine trust in democracy itself.With 85.5 per cent of Indian households owning at least one smartphone, mobile phones have become India‚Äôs bank, classroom and television, making citizens more vulnerable to digital deception.During the 2024 elections, for instance, satirical deepfakes became a campaign tool of sorts. Apart from resurrecting dead leaders, it featured clips such as one that featured PM Narendra Modi dancing the garba with women and Kamal Nath dissing a popular welfare scheme.Though investigations and arrests followed, such videos blur the line between fact and fiction, risking the distortion of voter opinion and the integrity of the democratic process.Cybersecurity experts warn AI is also becoming a key tool in cybercrime: 80 per cent phishing campaigns in 2024 involved AI, with deepfakes exploited for scams.‚ÄúWhen you can fake images, audio, and video, how do you know if a real video is real? Suddenly, everything is in question,‚Äù said Hany Farid, professor at the University of California, Berkeley, in a TOI interview last year about the worrying rise in AI misuse.The deepfake threat extends beyond politics. Recently, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted the misuse of AI to clone voices and produce fake videos impersonating her, warning of potential financial scams and the erosion of public trust. ‚ÄúI have seen several deepfake videos of myself being circulated online, manipulated to mislead citizens and distort facts,‚Äù Sitharaman said in Mumbai. ‚ÄúCriminals are using AI to mimic voices, clone identities, and create lifelike videos,‚Äù she added.Given that over 97% of India‚Äôs urban youth aged 15 to 29 owns a smartphone, the impact of such misinformation on a generation is worrying, say observers. ‚ÄúDeepfakes began in 2016. Back then, it was a joke. But the technology has only gotten better. Earlier, there were photoshopped face swaps. Now there are lipsync fakes,‚Äù said Prof. Farid, warning that the tech has become more refined, raising the risk of harassment of women through the use of non-consensual sexual imagery.In Nov 2023, actress Rashmika Mandanna became a victim of a viral deepfake video that superimposed her face on to compromising content, sparking widespread outrage. ‚ÄúThe very term ‚Äòdeepfake‚Äô comes from a Reddit user who in the early days of this technology used it to create porn,‚Äù said Farid, calling the new term ‚ÄòGenerative AI‚Äô clever ‚Äúrebranding‚Äù by the male-dominated tech industry.As AI evolves, India must strengthen legal frameworks, enhance digital literacy, and bring together minds across sectors to ensure safety, say experts. ‚ÄúWe need to label everything as real or not real,‚Äù said Farid, ‚ÄúWe need real disclosures.‚Äù To combat the deepening threat of deep fakes, TOI has already started armouring up. Watch out for our ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt Get Scammed‚Äô stories to stay informed and aware. After all, as Farid puts it, ‚Äúif you don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs real, how will you know what‚Äôs false‚Äù?
Article Summary: Ai-generated videos and audio clips don‚Äôt just distort reality. They manipulate public perception, spread misinformation and undermine trust in democracy itself. With 85.5 per cent of indian households owning at least one smartphone, mobile phones have become india‚Äôs bank, classroom and television.

Article Title: Modi unveils Skyroot's Infinity campus, India's 1st pvt commercial rocket; says India set to be global leader in sat launch ecosystem
Article Text:
PM Modi inaugurates Skyroot Aerospace‚Äôs Infinity campus in Hyderabad via video-conferencing

Explained: Why Vikram-I Could Transform India‚Äôs Satellite Launch Market And Global Space Leadership

HYDERABAD/NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday virtually inaugurated Hyderabad-based spacetech startup Skyroot Aerospace‚Äôs Infinity campus and unveiled India‚Äôs first commercial orbital rocket, Vikram-I, which will launch satellites into low Earth orbit (LEO).Emphasising that India is on track to emerge as a global leader in the satellite launch ecosystem, Modi said, ‚ÄúThe private sector is making giant strides in India's space sector. Skyroot's Infinity campus is a reflection of new thinking, innovation and most importantly, youth power. Our youth's innovation, risk-taking ability and entrepreneurship are touching new heights.‚ÄùExtending his best wishes to Skyroot CEO Pawan Kumar Chandana and company co-founder Naga Bharath Daka, the PM said the two entrepreneurs are an inspiration for young people. ‚ÄúGrowth of the private space sector, spearheaded by companies like Skyroot, is also a testament to the govt's efforts to foster innovation and private enterprise in the space domain,‚Äù he said.The Infinity facility, spread over 2 lakh sq ft in Hyderabad, will have the capability to design, develop, integrate and test multiple launch vehicles, with a capacity to build one orbital rocket every month. It adds to Skyroot's 55,000-sq-ft integrated rocket design and development facility ‚Äî Max-Q ‚Äî near Hyderabad airport.Pointing out that though India‚Äôs space journey began with limited resources, its ambitions were never limited, Modi said: ‚ÄúIndia has proven that the height of dreams is determined not by resources but by resolve. Today, India possesses space sector capabilities that only a few countries in the world have.‚ÄùHe also praised Isro, saying it ‚Äúhas for decades given new wings to India‚Äôs space journey.‚Äù Modi also recalled the reforms undertaken in the space sector, with his govt opening up the sector to private innovation and preparing a new Space Policy.Modi highlighted that more than 300 space startups are today powering India‚Äôs space aspirations, with most of them starting out with small teams. ‚ÄúGen-Z engineers, designers, coders and scientists are creating new technologies, whether in propulsion systems, composite materials, rocket stages or satellite platforms.‚ÄùSpace promoter and regulator IN-SPACe chairman Dr Pawan Goenka said that in just five years since the space sector was opened up, over 350 space startups have emerged. ‚ÄúThe Infinity campus and Vikram-1 are testaments to what can be achieved when entrepreneurial ambition meets enabling policy. We are building more than rockets. We are building a competitive space economy,‚Äù he said.Skyroot co-founder Pawan Chandana said the company was ready to launch Vikram-1, fully designed and built in India, in the next two months. Pointing out that decisive space reforms had unlocked the skies for startups to fly, co-founder Naga Bharath Daka said Skyroot has already generated over 1,000 hi-tech jobs and will be investing around Rs 1,000 crore soon to become one of the few companies worldwide to achieve rapid and on-demand launch capabilities.Set up in 2018 by the two IIT alumni and former Isro scientists, Skyroot became the first Indian company to successfully build and launch a rocket into space with suborbital rocket Vikram-S.
Article Summary: Pm narendra modi virtually inaugurated hyderabad-based spacetech startup skyroot aerospace‚Äôs infinity campus. The infinity facility, spread over 2 lakh sq ft in hyderabad, will have the capability to design, develop, integrate and test multiple launch vehicles. Vikram-i will launch satellites into low earth orbit (leo)

Article Title: MLB trade rumors: Toronto Blue Jays predicted to bag $79 million Philadelphia Phillies star to improve middle-order and bolster title odds
Article Text:
Toronto Blue Jays Shortstop Bo Bichette (Image via Getty)

Kyle Schwarber

Toronto Blue Jays

Trade Structure and Proposed Framework

Why Toronto Blue Jays Would Make This Move

Kyle Schwarber of the Phillies (Image via Imagn)

Why the Phillies Would Accept

On-Field Fit and Lineup Impact

Pros, Cons, and Overall Verdict

A blockbuster trade built aroundand thewould instantly become one of the most fascinating storylines of the winter. While not an active or imminent negotiation, the concept makes enough baseball sense that it continues to surface in league speculation. The idea centers on Toronto gaining the middle-order thunder they‚Äôve lacked, while Philadelphia reallocates resources from an aging slugger to a younger, more controllable core.The financial mechanics are a major part of the intrigue. Schwarber is expected to land a contract in the $35-40 million AAV range over four seasons, a level that reflects his near-MVP offensive output and long r√©sum√© of postseason impact. Any team acquiring him must weigh both the production and the significant financial weight attached.A clean version of this hypothetical deal sends Schwarber to Toronto - potentially with a bit of cash relief - while Philadelphia receives a versatile, inexpensive bat such as Davis Schneider plus one MLB-ready arm or upper-minors pitching prospect. The Phillies could choose to absorb a slice of Schwarber‚Äôs contract to upgrade the talent level coming back, a familiar tactic in trades involving star hitters on nine-figure deals.Toronto‚Äôs current roster leans heavily on Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Anthony Santander for power, with no true left-handed, full-time DH threat. Schwarber solves that instantly. He would slot into the No. 2 or No. 4 spot, surrounding Guerrero with on-base ability and elite home-run production. With seasons of 38 homers in 2024 and a massive 56-homer, 132-RBI campaign in 2025, he becomes their most dangerous slugger since the Bautista-Encarnaci√≥n era. Toronto also gains a hitter built for October, as Schwarber owns double-digit postseason home runs and deep-run experience with multiple organizations.For Philadelphia, the logic is financial efficiency and roster balance. Committing four years of near-MVP money to a slugger in his mid-30s is risky, especially with existing large contracts on the books. Trading Schwarber gives them payroll room to strengthen pitching and defense while adding long-term value in the form of Schneider and a young arm. The Phillies also have some redundancy in corner power bats and have shown interest in distributing DH at-bats more broadly.Schwarber becomes Toronto‚Äôs primary DH, with occasional starts in left field. This reshapes the top six: George Springer, Schwarber, Guerrero Jr., Santander, Daulton Varsho, and Andres Gimenez - a group that forces opposing managers into difficult bullpen decisions due to alternating handedness and multiple 30-plus-homer threats.Toronto gains a game-changing middle-order hammer, improved lineup balance, and proven playoff power. The risks involve Schwarber‚Äôs defensive limitations, strikeout rate, and the aging curve tied to a large multiyear contract. Philadelphia, meanwhile, gains payroll flexibility, youth, and positional versatility but loses a fan-favorite slugger and must replace 40‚Äì50 homers in the near term.Also read: MLB trade rumors: New York Mets could acquire $15 million San Diego Padres Starter after Dylan Cease deal In the short run, Toronto likely wins the on-field upgrade. Long-term, Philadelphia can come out ahead if the returned players develop and the payroll space fuels a deeper, more balanced roster.
Article Summary: Kyle schwarber is expected to land a contract in the $35-40 million aav range over four seasons. Toronto gains a game-changing middle-order hammer, improved lineup balance, and proven playoff power. Philadelphia gains payroll flexibility, youth, and positional versatility but loses a fan-favorite slugger.

Article Title: Who is Bridget Condon? NFL reporter‚Äôs selfie with Chad Ochocinco blows up online after bold message for ex-boyfriend
Article Text:
Who is Bridget Condon? NFL reporter‚Äôs selfie with Chad Ochocinco blows up online after bold message for ex-boyfriend (Image Via Getty)

Bridget Condon‚Äôs viral post with Chad Ochocinco and the story behind her career rise

Bridget Condon went viral on Friday night, November 28, after she posted a selfie with Chad Ochocinco on X. The NFL reporter added a caption aimed at an ex-boyfriend who once told her she would never grow as a sports reporter. The picture spread very fast on social media, pulling in millions of views within hours.In her post, Bridget Condon shared that this ex asked her to quit reporting in her early career and live with him instead. Because he was a big fan of Chad Ochocinco, she said taking a selfie with the former NFL star felt like the perfect way to send a simple and funny message back. Fans immediately picked up the story and began sharing it across the platform.The selfie, shared on November 28, crossed 3.8 million views and more than 12,000 likes by the next morning.Many users praised her confidence and her journey. One fan wrote, ‚ÄúYou proved him wrong,‚Äù while another said, ‚ÄúYou stayed focused and it paid off.‚Äù People liked how she handled the moment with humor instead of anger.Bridget Condon has spent years working in sports media. She attended James Madison University and studied Media Arts & Design and Spanish, according the NFL's official website.Following her 2015 graduation, she pursued digital communication at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.Soon after, she started her first work at WCAV-TV in Charlottesville, Virginia, acting as a sports anchor and reporter for two years.She next went WTVD-TV in Durham, North Carolina, where for four years she reported on professional and local sports.She started with NFL Media in October 2021, where she contributes on several NFL programs, provides live updates, and reports from the field.Bridget Condon was an athlete at Holliston High School prior to journalism, participating in lacrosse, field hockey, and winter running.She has said in earlier interviews that her passion for soccer first began on Friday evenings at her school field and those events drove her toward sports journalism.Her viral moment with Chad Ochocinco once again highlighted her trip, demonstrating how far she has come despite initial reservations from others.Also Read: Is Drake London Playing In Week 13 Vs The Jets? Latest Injury Update On Him Amid The Team‚Äôs Losing Streak
Article Summary: Bridget condon posted a selfie with former nfl star chad ochocinco on x. The nfl reporter added a caption aimed at an ex-boyfriend who once told her she would never grow as a sports reporter. The picture spread very fast on social media, pulling in millions of views within hours.

Article Title: Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff says he's never going to use ChatGPT again: It feels like ...
Article Text:
Tech leaders acknowledge Gemini 3.0 success





OpenAI's Master Plan for India





Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff has declared that he will not use ChatGPT, the AI chatbot developed by Microsoft-backed AI company OpenAI . His comments came after he used Google‚Äôs latest AI model, Gemini 3.0, stating that a two-hour experience with Google‚Äôs new model has convinced him to switch permanently. Google CEO Sundar Pichai termed the Gemini 3 as the company‚Äôs ‚Äúmost intelligent model, that combines all of Gemini‚Äôs capabilities together so you can bring any idea to life. ‚ÄùIn a post on X, Benioff claimed that Gemini 3.0 has brought a monumental shift in the AI landscape. The CEO specifically praised Gemini 3‚Äôs performance across multiple modalities, noting key improvements in reasoning, speed, image quality, and video processing as the compelling factors behind his decision.‚ÄúHoly shit. I‚Äôve used ChatGPT every day for 3 years. Just spent 2 hours on Gemini 3. I‚Äôm not going back. The leap is insane ‚Äî reasoning, speed, images, video‚Ä¶ everything is sharper and faster. It feels like the world just changed, again. ‚ù§Ô∏è ü§ñ‚ÄùBenioff‚Äôs endorsement highlights the competitive pressure now facing OpenAI as models from rival tech giants like Google make significant advances. Tesla CEO Elon Musk and even OpenAI chief executive Sam Altman praised Pichai following the launch of Gemini 3.The xAI founder said ‚ÄúCongrats‚Äù on Pichai‚Äôs "Geminiii" announcement on X, and ‚ÄúNice Work‚Äù to Demis Hassabis, the chief of DeepMind. Altman posted ‚ÄúCongrats to Google on Gemini 3! Looks like a great model.‚ÄùAltman even noted potential ‚Äútemporary economic headwinds‚Äù in an internal memo but expressed confidence in OpenAl‚Äôs rapid progress and leadership in the Al race.‚ÄúWe have built enough strength as a company to weather great models shipping elsewhere competition... (so), having most of our research team focused on really getting to superintelligence is critically important,‚Äù Altman wrote in the internal memo.Stripe CEO Patrick Collison also posted on X that Gemini 3 built him an ‚Äúinteractive web page summarising 10 breakthroughs in genetics,‚Äù and called it ‚Äúpretty cool.‚Äù Nvidia also replied to Google stock rally, priasing Google's growth.
Article Summary: Salesforce ceo mark benioff has declared that he will not use chatgpt, the ai chatbot developed by microsoft-backed ai company openai. His comments came after he used google‚Äôs latest ai model, gemini 3.0, stating that a two-hour experience with the model has convinced him to switch permanently.

Article Title: Mark Cuban to Perplexity, OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Microsoft: You are overspending on AI, only one you will ...
Article Text:
Overspending and the AI Bubble





What Is Artificial Intelligence? Explained Simply With Real-Life Examples

Disruption will come from the unexpected





Take lessons from the dot-com era









Billionaire investor and Shark Tank judge Mark Cuban has now issued a warning to leading artificial intelligence companies including Perplexity, OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Microsoft and Meta. Cuban has argued that all these companies are overspending in the race to build the world‚Äôs most powerful AI model. As reported by Business Insider, speaking in the Pioneers of AI podcast, Cuban compared today‚Äôs AI arms race to the search engine boom of 1990s. The search engine boom ultimately ended with Google dominating the market and leaving all the rivals behind.‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got five, six, whatever it is, companies that are trying to create the ultimate foundational model that we all depend on,‚Äù Cuban said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs almost like in the ‚Äô90s when all the search engines were competing pre-Google‚Ä¶ Now, we know with search engines it‚Äôs Google, and then there‚Äôs Bing, as, like, 1 or 2% and DuckDuckGo has got a half a percent. So it‚Äôs effectively a winner-take-all.‚ÄùLike many other world leaders and analysts Cuban has also cautioned that the massive investments done on AI could ultimately lead to the creation of a bubble. ‚ÄúThey may be overspending,‚Äù he said.‚ÄúAnd if they overspend or get too caught up, the bubble is in the competition between all those models because that could pop just like that with any new technology.‚ÄùAlong with this, he also raised concerns about the infrastructure costs behind AI, majorly the massive and expensive data centers which are being built to power large models. ‚ÄúI just can‚Äôt imagine over a 10-year period that we aren‚Äôt going to improve the technology enough that if you overspend on today‚Äôs technology, it just doesn‚Äôt feel right to me,‚Äù Cuban added.Cuban also emphasised that the disruption AI will not come from incremental improvements but from something ‚Äúincredible‚Äù that no one sees coming. ‚ÄúSomebody‚Äôs going to come up with some incredible shit, right? If I knew what it was, I‚Äôd do it,‚Äù he said, suggesting that the current race may be blindsided by a breakthrough outside the existing competition.Cuban said he recognizes the same mix of hype, excitement, and overspending now playing out in AI. ‚ÄúThey anticipate for at least another decade spending every penny they have,‚Äù he said of the major model developers. ‚ÄúI mean, if that‚Äôs not ripe for disruption to come up with better ways, I don‚Äôt know what is.‚Äù
Article Summary: Billionaire investor and shark tank judge mark cuban has issued a warning to leading artificial intelligence companies including perplexity, openai, anthropic, google, microsoft and meta. Cuban has argued that all these companies are overspending in the race to build the world‚Äôs most powerful ai model.

Article Title: ChatGPT ‚Äòhacked‚Äô: Names, email addresses exposed; company warns: As a reminder, don't do ‚Ä¶
Article Text:

Referring websites and Organisation/User IDs

‚ÄúTrust, security, and privacy are foundational to our products, our organization, and our mission. We are committed to transparency, and are notifying all impacted customers and users. We also hold our partners and vendors accountable for the highest bar for security and privacy of their services.

After reviewing this incident, OpenAI has terminated its use of Mixpanel. Beyond Mixpanel, we are conducting additional and expanded security reviews across our vendor ecosystem and are elevating security requirements for all partners and vendors.

OpenAI's Master Plan for India

OpenAI‚Äôs security advice to affected users





Be cautious with unexpected emails or messages, especially those containing links or attachments.

Verify that any message claiming to be from OpenAI is sent from an official OpenAI domain.

Note that OpenAI does not ask for passwords, API keys, or verification codes through email, text, or chat.

Strengthen account security by enabling multi-factor authentication.
Article Summary: ‚Äútrust, security, and privacy are foundational to our products, our organization, and our mission. We are committed to transparency, and are notifying all impacted customers and users. After reviewing this incident, openai has terminated its use of mixpanel.

Article Title: Bill Gates wants you to read these 5 books as 2025 comes to end, almost
Article Text:
The five books that Bill Gates wants you to read





Remarkably Bright Creatures by Shelby Van Pelt

Clearing the Air by Hannah Ritchie

Bill Gates No Longer among Top 10 Billionaires: The Real Reason

Who Knew by Barry Diller

When Everyone Knows That Everyone Knows by Steven Pinker

Abundance by Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson





Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has revealed his annual holiday reading list as the 2025 comes to a close. Gates has recommended five books and he believes that all these titles spark curiosity and reflection during the quieter days of the winter season. ‚ÄúEach of these books pulls back the curtain on how something important really works: how people find purpose later in life, how we should think about climate change, how creative industries evolve, how humans communicate,‚Äù wrote Gates.In the blog post, Gates has also explained that holidays are the perfect tome to slow down and also catch up on reading. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something about the quieter days around the holidays that makes it easier to sit down with a good book,‚Äù he wrote. His list on 2025 book recommendations reflects on his fascination with how the world works and how you can start a great conversation.The book belongs to the fiction genre and its a story of an aging janitor and a wise octopus captive hime with its empathy and storytelling. ‚ÄúVan Pelt's story made me think about the challenge of filling the days after you stop working‚Äîand what communities can do to help older people find purpose,‚Äù said Gates.The books explains about the climate challenges. The book structures 50 big questions on climate change, nuclear power and renewables. ‚Äú I‚Äôve followed Hannah‚Äôs work at Our World in Data for years, and her new book is one of the clearest explanations of the climate challenge I‚Äôve read. She‚Äôs realistic about the risks but grounded in data that shows real progress,‚Äù said Gates.It is a memoir which recounts the Diller‚Äôs extraordinary career in Hollywood, media, and technology, blending personal anecdotes with reflections on power, risk-taking, and the evolution of entertainment and digital industries. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs spent his life betting on ideas before they were obvious, and the industries he‚Äôs transformed show how much those bets can pay off,‚Äù said Gates.The book explains about the mysteries of human behaviour and how people communicate. ‚ÄúAlthough the topic itself is pretty complicated, the book is readable and practical, and it made me see everyday social interactions in a new light,‚Äù added Gate.The books offers a glimpse of at why America seems to struggle to build things and what it will take to fix that. The book argues that progress depends not just on good ideas but on the systems that help ideas spread.
Article Summary: Microsoft co-founder bill gates has revealed his annual holiday reading list as the 2025 comes to a close. Gates has recommended five books and he believes that all these titles spark curiosity and reflection during the quieter days of the winter season.

Article Title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai: Hopefully I, and my teams, get a ...
Article Text:
Sundar Pichai (Image credit: BBC interview/ Youtube)

Gemini 3 boosts Google‚Äôs market value





Google To Invest $15 Billion On AI Hub In Visakhapatnam, CEO Sundar Pichai Speaks To PM Modi

Years of hard work





Google CEO Sundar Pichai on AI layoffs









Google recently launched its most-advanced AI model ‚Äî Gemini 3.0. Announcing the launch of Gemini 3.0, Google CEO Sundar Pichai said that it is ‚Äòthe best model in the world for multimodal understanding‚Äô. Now weeks after the intense work on Gemini 3.0, Google CEO Sundar Pichai has acknowledged that his engineers are overdue for a break. As reported by Business Insider, speaking on the Google AI‚Äù Release Notes podcast, Pichai said ‚ÄúI think some folks need some sleep,‚Äù adding that hopefully he and his teams ‚Äúget a bit of rest‚Äù now that the milestone launch is behind them.The comment made by Pichai comes as Google is moving towards a $4 trillion market cap as the stock price of the company has surged by nearly 70% this year, including a 12% jump following Gemini 3‚Äôs debut on November 18. The Gemini 3.0 model has been widely praised for its reasoning, speed and multimodal capabilities. Recently, Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff also described the Gemini 3.0 model as an ‚Äòinsane‚Äô leap forward. He also added that after using Gemini 3.0 for two hours he will not go back to ChatGPT.After the successful roll out of Gemini 3.0, Google has managed to reclaim its frontrunner position in the AI race. Pichai noted that years of hard work of the company is the sole reason behind this success.‚ÄúIn 2016, I wanted the whole company to be AI-first,‚Äù he said, pointing to milestones such as the creation of Google Brain in 2012, the acquisition of DeepMind in 2014, AlphaGo‚Äôs victory in Go, and the unveiling of Google‚Äôs own tensor processing units (TPUs), which were used to train Gemini.Pichai further talked about the Google‚Äôs strategy. Pichai explained that Google always worked towards a ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù approach to innovation, improving everything from infrastructure to model training and test-time compute. He admitted that when generative AI first gained traction, Google was short on capacity and had to invest heavily to scale. ‚ÄúIf you were on the outside, it would look like we were quiet, or we were behind, but we were putting all the building blocks in place, and then executing on top of it,‚Äù he said.Recently, Google CEO Sundar Pichai talked about AI layoffs. In a recent expansive interview with BBC, Sundar Pichai pushed back against concerns that AI could eventually lead to mass job cuts. Pichai said that the tech will eliminate some jobs but also ‚Äúevolve and transition‚Äù others -- ramifications that mean "people will need to adapt."Pichai further added that AI may be gunning for his job, but he doesn‚Äôt seem too worried about it. AI is advancing so swiftly, he said, that over the next 12 months the tech will be able to perform ‚Äúcomplex‚Äù tasks and act as an agent on a users' behalf. "That‚Äôs where it gets really interesting," he said.
Article Summary: Google recently launched its most-advanced ai model ‚Äî gemini 3.0. Google ceo sundar pichai has acknowledged that his engineers are overdue for a break. The comment comes as google is moving towards a $4 trillion market cap as the stock price has surged by nearly 70% this year.

Article Title: TCS signs 5-year deal to help SAP with cloud and AI adoption
Article Text:
How TCS and SAP‚Äôs deal will work



‚ÄúTCS and SAP have been a strategic partnership for more than two-decades, enabling enterprises to navigate complex digital transformation journeys. We support the ‚ÄúSAP runs SAP‚Äù philosophy and as we enter the next phase, this collaboration shall leverage transformative potential of AI and cloud to unlock new revenue streams, accelerate business growth, and deliver differentiated experiences for enterprise and their customers globally.‚Äù





Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) and SAP, a major company for business software and artificial intelligence (AI), have signed a new five-year agreement. The goal of this deal is to help businesses use cloud technology and AI more effectively. In a blog post, TCS announced that it will help improve SAP‚Äôs operations by simplifying its complex IT systems, making day-to-day work smoother, and strengthening its AI tools. This partnership aims to shorten development cycles, reduce the total cost of running IT and ensure that technology goals align with business goals.This new deal builds on an existing partnership between TCS and SAP that has lasted for twenty years. Previously, TCS helped SAP shift its business model from selling software licenses to offering flexible, cloud-based services (called RISE with SAP). Over the next five years, TCS will focus on transforming how SAP's IT department operates to accelerate new ideas and respond more quickly to business needs.TCS will help SAP deliver critical services throughout the lifecycle of IT applications as part of its enterprise IT transformation.This will be done using a unified, efficient, and AI-powered model. The partnership will be supported by four key Centres of Excellence (CoE): Generative AI, Business Technology Platform, Business Data Cloud, and Customer Experience.The Generative AI CoE will focus on integrating GenAI capabilities into SAP business processes. The Business Technology Platform CoE will help SAP build new features more quickly using low-code and no-code tools.The Business Data Cloud CoE will work on creating a unified data structure so SAP can turn enterprise data into products. The Customer Experience CoE will explore new ways to understand and improve customer experience across SAP‚Äôs value chain.Together, these CoEs will help SAP develop solutions, technologies and processes that allow customers, partners, and employees to discover new growth opportunities.For the past 20 years, TCS has been a trusted partner for SAP across its entire business. Their collaboration has helped clients make full use of SAP‚Äôs cloud, AI, and data analytics capabilities.Commenting on the new deal, V Rajanna, president of technology, software and services at TCS, said:
Article Summary: Tcs and sap have signed a new five-year agreement. The goal of this deal is to help businesses use cloud technology and ai more effectively. This partnership aims to shorten development cycles, reduce the total cost of running it and ensure that technology goals align with business goals.

Article Title: Ekman, who linked facial expressions to emotions, dies at 91
Article Text: Paul Ekman, a psychologist who linked thousands of facial expressions to the emotions they often subconsciously conveyed, and who used his research to advise FBI interrogators and screeners for the Transportation Security Administration as well as Hollywood animators, died Nov 17 at his home in San Francisco. He was 91.Ekman sought to add scientific exactitude to the human impulse to interpret how others feel through their facial expressions. He recorded 18 types of smiles, for example, distinguishing between a forced smile and a spontaneous one; a genuine smile, he discovered, crinkles the orbicularis oculi muscle - that is, it creates crow's feet around the eyes.Sometimes described as the world's most famous face reader, Ekman was influential in reshaping the way facial expressions were understood - as the product of evolution rather than environment - and his findings crossed over to popular culture.As a young researcher in the late 1960s, Ekman changed the scientific consensus on facial expressions. In the postwar era, the conventional wisdom of eminent anthropologists like Margaret Mead was that human facial expressions were learned and that they varied across cultures. Ekman believed otherwise. He showed photographs of people making faces expressing 30 different emotions - including anger, joy and fear - to subjects in the United States, Japan and South America.Across cultures, the study's participants linked the expressions they were shown with the same emotions.He then travelled to Papua New Guinea with a colleague, Wallace V Friesen, and showed the same pictures to some 300 Indigenous people who had no exposure to modern media and could not have learned to interpret faces that way. These subjects also connected the expressions to the same emotions."There is a pan-cultural element in facial expressions of emotion," Ekman wrote in a paper in 1970 on returning to the United States.
Article Summary: Paul ekman, a psychologist who linked thousands of facial expressions to the emotions they often subconsciously conveyed, died nov 17 at his home in san francisco. Ekman was influential in reshaping the way facial expressions were understood. He recorded 18 types of smiles, for example, distinguishing between a forced smile and a spontaneous one.

Article Title: Raja Krishnamoorthi slammed for his proposal to double H-1B visas to 130,000: 'He's serving India'
Article Text:
H-1B Controversy Erupts After US Economist Alleges Industrial-Scale Fraud Targeting Indian Visas

'Zero Americans are named Raja Krishnamoorthi'





Indian-origin Democratic Congressman (Illinois) Raja Krishnamoorthi was criticized for reintroducing an Act that he proposed earlier to increase the number of H-1B visas available each year. The move was called 'vicious' and 'tone-deaf' on social media as the administration is dealing with a major H-1B controversy after President Donald Trump said America needs certain talents but MAGA doesn't agree.The High-Skilled Immigration Reform for Employment (HIRE) Act proposes to increase the number of available H-1B visas from 65,000 to 130,000. The proposal says this would ensure US employers, including those in critical and emerging technology sectors, can recruit the specialized talent needed to fill persistent workforce shortages.To shield itself from criticism, the bill also directs new funding to strengthen STEM programs in US schools.‚ÄúTo build the jobs and industries of tomorrow, America must stay at the forefront of innovation by strengthening our own workforce while continuing to welcome top talent from around the globe,‚Äù Krishnamoorthi said. ‚ÄúThe HIRE Act advances both goals by boosting STEM education in our elementary and secondary schools and by expanding the annual supply of H-1B visas from 65,000 to 130,000.By growing our domestic talent pipeline and ensuring employers can recruit the skilled workers they need, we can create good-paying jobs and secure America‚Äôs leadership in the technologies of the future. ‚ÄùSocial media users called for Krishnamoorthi's deportation as they claimed that he should not be in Congress if he is serving India. "Zero Americans are named Raja Krishnamoorthi. Deport that man," one wrote. Another called him 'Raja Krishnamoorthi of New Delhi'. Social media users also reacted as to why he was so interested in H-1B as there are no large tech companies in Illinois.Krishnamoorthi's bill is supported by ITServe Alliance, the nation‚Äôs largest association of IT services firms. ‚ÄúThe HIRE Act is an important step toward modernizing our high-skilled immigration system and ensuring that talented professionals can continue to contribute to America‚Äôs innovation economy," governing board chair of ITServe Alliance Raghu Chittimalla said
Article Summary: Indian-origin democratic congressman (illinois) raja krishnamoorthi was criticized for reintroducing an act that he proposed earlier to increase the number of h-1b visas available each year. The move was called 'vicious' and 'tone-deaf' on social media.

Article Title: UAE launches region first digital marketplace app for buying and trading trademarks
Article Text:
UAE launches platform to buy and sell trademarks easily / AI Generated Image

What is TM Marketplace?

How does the UAE platform work?

Secure Transactions: All buying and selling activities require users to log in for identity verification, and financial transactions are completed seamlessly using secure digital payment systems.

Verified Assets Only: To protect investors, only national and international trademarks officially registered in the UAE can be listed on the platform.

Regulatory Oversight: The Ministry of Economy provides direct supervision, guaranteeing full compliance with both national and international IP laws, including the foundational Federal Decree-Law No. 36 of 2021 on Trademarks.

Lowering Market Barriers: For entrepreneurs and international investors, the platform provides access to ready-made or promising brands, drastically cutting the time and risk typically involved in starting a business from scratch in the UAE market.

No download, no subscription





The UAE‚Äôs Ministry of Economy & Tourism has unveiled TM Market Place, the Middle East‚Äôs first dedicated digital platform for listing, buying and trading registered trademarks. The platform aims to turn intangible brand assets into more liquid, tradable items, boost trademark registrations and attract global brands to the UAE market.TM Market Place provides a central online venue where owners of trademarks registered in the UAE can list their marks for sale or license, and where buyers and investors can discover, evaluate and acquire brand assets. The platform was developed under the UAE Government Leaders Programme and intends to make trademark transactions faster, more transparent and easier to manage, bringing a new commercial use for intellectual property in the region.The platform was carefully developed through a strategic collaboration between the MoET and the UAE Government Leaders Programme, ensuring it meets the highest international standards for security and transparency. It acts as a trusted digital bridge seamlessly connecting sellers with a wide, diverse base of local and international investors worldwide.Here‚Äôs how the process is streamlined:For those eager to jump into the world of brand trading, accessing the TM Market Place is intentionally simple and user-friendly.The Ministry of Economy and Tourism (MoET) established the platform as a secure online digital portal, meaning there is no mobile application to download from an app store.Users can access the marketplace directly through the MoET's web services and must log in to ensure identity verification and transaction security.Crucially, there is no subscription fee required to browse, list, or access the marketplace. The platform operates as a government-overseen exchange. Any costs incurred are directly related to the transaction itself: the agreed-upon purchase price of the trademark (paid to the seller) and the subsequent official government fee for the mandatory legal process of re-registering the brand's ownership in the buyer's name.This free-to-access model removes financial hurdles for new investors and keeps the focus solely on the value of the intellectual property being traded.
Article Summary: Uae launches platform to buy and sell trademarks easily. Tm market place is middle east‚Äôs first dedicated digital platform for listing, buying and trading registered trademarks. The platform aims to turn intangible brand assets into more liquid, tradable items, boost trademark registrations and attract global brands to the uae market.

Article Title: Emirates offers a Thanksgiving menu at 35,000 feet ‚Äî with turkey trimmings and NBA action onboard
Article Text:
Emirates brings festive Thanksgiving flavours to holiday travellers / AI generated image

Emirates offer gourmet Thanksgiving

from

to

Cabin Class Route to USA (from Dubai) Route from USA (to Dubai) First Class Main Course: Traditional Turkey Leg Roulade with roasted butternut, mashed potatoes, buttered Brussels sprouts, and cranberry jus li√©. Main Course: Lemon, Zaatar, and Buttermilk Roasted Turkey with celeriac apple pur√©e and maple-roasted pumpkin. Appetizer: Smoked salmon. Appetizer: Seafood platter featuring caviar, poached prawn, and crab cocktail. Dessert: Warm apple fritters or key lime tart. Dessert: Hot toffee apple and pecan cake or chocolate marble cheesecake. Business Class Main courses feature either the turkey roulade or the lemon Zaatar turkey, alongside sides like salmon gravadlax with Beluga caviar. Desserts include key lime tart or cheesecake with strawberry basil confit.

JD Vance & Family Serve Thanksgiving Meal To US Soldiers At Fort Campbell | Watch

Lounges, routes and extras

ice

How much do tickets cost?





Emirates is elevating Thanksgiving for international travelers, serving traditional festive menus across all cabin classes on flights to and from its 12 US gateways from November 24 to 30. The celebration begins even before takeoff, with holiday dining running in select Emirates Lounges from November 23.This is a comprehensive dining program, ensuring passengers flying across the Atlantic can enjoy an authentic, high-end holiday meal complete with gourmet sides and themed entertainment.The holiday dining experience is meticulously tailored, offering separate menus for passengers flyingthe US andthe US, particularly in First Class.All First, Business, and Premium Economy customers start their day with a special Thanksgiving breakfast of cinnamon pancakes topped with seasonal apple & cranberry compote and a luxurious whipped ricotta pumpkin cream. Business Class also receives complimentary blueberry muffins and cinnamon rolls.The holiday experience extends beyond the meal tray into Emirates‚Äô world-class facilities on the ground and in the air, ensuring continuous festive cheer.US Lounges (New York, Boston, Los Angeles, San Francisco) serve a roasted mushroom bisque, followed by Cider-Brined Turkey Breast with brioche stuffing, traditional gravy, cranberry compote, and creamy mashed potatoes.Dubai Lounges feature a roasted turkey breast, glazed chestnuts, roasted root vegetables, and a dessert spread that includes classic pecan pie, white chocolate and cranberry cheesecake, and pumpkin cranberry cheesecake. Guests can also enjoy festive mocktails and cocktails like the Pumpkin Spiced Martini or Maple Pumpkin Sangria.Onboard the iconic A380 aircraft (flying from Dubai to Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, and Washington D.C.), First and Business Class customers can visit the Onboard Lounge for pecan cupcakes with cream cheese frosting, paired with premium beverages. Passengers can settle in to watch live NBA games on Sport24 and Sport24 Extra throughout the holiday period. Theentertainment system also offers 6,500 channels, including movies, TV shows, and holiday-themed content.While this exceptional Thanksgiving dining experience is a complimentary benefit with every ticket purchased on US routes, the final price you pay ultimately depends entirely on your specific travel dates and class. Securing the best value during the peak holiday travel period often requires planning; experts still recommend booking carefully six to ten weeks in advance to maximize savings.Generally, round-trip Economy fares between the US and Dubai range from approximately $1,200 to $2,200 (AED 4,400 to AED 8,100). For those indulging in the enhanced Business Class menus, which include lie-flat seats and exclusive lounge access, expect prices to range from $3,000 to $5,000 (AED 11,000 to AED 18,350) or more.To find the most current and exact pricing for your specific dates, travelers should use Emirates‚Äô official online search tools and consider using Skywards Miles for potential savings.
Article Summary: Emirates brings festive thanksgiving flavours to holiday travellers. The celebration begins even before takeoff, with holiday dining running in select emirates lounges from november 23. The holiday experience extends beyond the meal tray into emirates‚Äô world-class facilities on the ground and in the air.

Article Title: Human washing machine goes on sale in Japan
Article Text: TOKYO: After wowing World Expo visitors, a human washing machine is now on sale in Japan, a company spokeswoman said Friday.Users lie down in the pod, close the lid and get cleaned like clothes in a washing machine -- but without the spin -- while music plays.A prototype of the device, called the human washer of the future, attracted long queues at the six-month Expo that wrapped up in Osaka in October after welcoming over 27 million people.Made by Japanese firm Science, the device is an update of a product displayed the last time Osaka hosted the event, in 1970."Our (company) president was inspired by that as a 10-year-old boy at the time," Science spokeswoman Sachiko Maekura told AFP.The machine "not only washes your body but also your soul," she added, while also monitoring users' heartbeats and other vital signs.After a US resort company contacted Science to see if the prototype would be commercialised, the firm decided to produce it for real.A hotel in Osaka bought the first machine and is preparing to offer the service to hotel guests, the spokeswoman said.Other customers include Yamada Denki, a major consumer electronics retail chain in Japan, which hopes the machine will draw people to visit its outlets, she said."Because part of the appeal of this machine is rarity, we plan to produce only about 50 units," Maekura said.Local media reported that the retail price will be 60 million yen ($385,000).
Article Summary: Users lie down in the pod, close the lid and get cleaned like clothes in a washing machine. A prototype of the device attracted long queues at the six-month expo. The device is an update of a product displayed the last time osaka hosted the event.

Article Title: Watch: Camera dipped into Japanese drain stuns viewers ‚Äî netizens joke 'phir Nobita kis gutter mein girta tha?'
Article Text:
Screengrab from viral video (Instagram/@thechaosdiaries)





A video showcasing the unexpected beauty of Japan‚Äôs gutter has gone viral on social media, drawing widespread attention for its surprising clarity and vibrant aquatic life.Shared by UK travel blogger Alicia Cooper, the clip captures fish swimming in crystal-clear water inside a gutter on Koi no Oyogu Machi Street in Shimabara, a city on Japan‚Äôs Kyushu island.In the video, Cooper dips her camera into the drainage canal, revealing colorful fishes gliding gracefully. A text overlay on the clip reads: ‚ÄúPOV: you stick your camera in a gutter in Japan.‚ÄùCooper clarified in the video that the gutter is not part of the city‚Äôs sewage system, but a drainage canal fed by natural spring water. She added that the koi fish were introduced in the 1970s to attract tourists.The video, posted on Monday, has already garnered over 4 lakh likes. Cooper also cautioned viewers: ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt look like this in England. So, please don‚Äôt visit Japan expecting them all to look like this!‚ÄùThe post has sparked reactions from social media users. One commented: ‚ÄúEven the rivers of India are not this much clean as the gutters of Japan are.‚Äù Another wrote: ‚ÄúWe can never worry about falling and getting dirty later in Japan.‚ÄùA netizen reacted to the video and quipped, ‚ÄúPhir Nobita kis gutter mein girta tha?‚Äù (In which drain did Nobita fall?) ‚Äî referring to the character from Doraemon.Cooper also shared a tip for viewers interested in seeing the site themselves, highlighting that Shimabara‚Äôs canals are fed by natural springs and hundreds of koi have been released along some of these waterways for tourists.
Article Summary: Video shows fish swimming in crystal-clear water inside a gutter in shimabara, japan. Uk travel blogger alicia cooper shared the video on instagram, where it has gone viral. The gutter is not part of the city‚Äôs sewage system, but a drainage canal.
